comments.body:
Please don't hard-code the `any` type parameter in the `StorageAdapter` type to allow users of this type to use this parameter to correctly align `get()` and `set()` signatures of the `StorageAdapter` implementation:

```suggestion
    type StorageAdapter<TValue> = Store<TValue>;
```

Don't forget to set this parameter to `any` in the CacheableRequest constructor argument.

Isn't the value type determined by the library? It's not as if the caller can meaningfully declare any type they choose; for their type to be helpful it needs to conform to the library's usage:

```js
{
  cachePolicy: response.cachePolicy.toObject(),
  url: response.url,
  statusCode: response.fromCache ? revalidate.statusCode : response.statusCode,
  body
}
```

If we don't use `Store<any>` it seems like it would be better to add an explicit type for the cache value.
If you would add an explicit type for the cache value, that would be great! Otherwise, stick with what you've done so far.
Thanks, I'm happy to address that in a follow-on.
